docs.snippet: Those who fight to defend the Constitution understand its worth....
docs.lead_paragraph: Those who fight to defend the Constitution understand its worth.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Sarah Vowell examines letter sent by George Washington to Rhode Island synagogue in 1790, just months after final ratification of Constitution, in which he underscored the Constitution's clear prohibition against bigotry and inequality; suggests Donald Trump's statements about naturalized citizens Khizr and Ghazala Khan should cause Republican Party to consider whether their nominees be required to take test gauging their true understanding of meaning and mechanics of United States Constitution.

headline.main: Join the Army and Choose Whichever God You Like
headline.print_headline: Join the Army, Love the Constitution and Pray to Whomever You Like

docs.snippet: Hate speech from the campaign is poisoning schools and communities....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hate speech from the campaign is poisoning schools and communities.
docs.abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column warns Donald Trump's coarse rhetoric on campaign trail is rending social fabric of country; expresses concern that long after campaign is over, Americans will continue to be forced to deal with hate-filled, and poorly informed, beast Trump has unleashed.

headline.main: Donald Trump Is Making America Meaner

docs.snippet: South Africa's ruling African National Congress wants the national budget "re-prioritized" to focus on tackling poverty, unemployment and inequality following local election defeats this month, the party said on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: South Africa's ruling African National Congress wants the national budget "re-prioritized" to focus on tackling poverty, unemployment and inequality following local election defeats this month, the party said on Sunday.

headline.main: South Africa's ANC Wants Budget 'Re-Prioritized' After Vote Losses

docs.snippet: The daylight slaying of a mosque leader and his associate set off fear and anguish Sunday among Bangladeshi Muslims in a New York City neighborhood, with some saying the killings appear to be an anti-Muslim hate crime. But police said there is no ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The daylight slaying of a mosque leader and his associate set off fear and anguish Sunday among Bangladeshi Muslims in a New York City neighborhood, with some saying the killings appear to be an anti-Muslim hate crime. But police said there is no evidence so far to support that.

headline.main: Friends Call Imam Slaying a Hate Crime; Cops Say No Motive
headline.print_headline: Friends Call Imam Slaying a Hate Crime; Cops Say No Motive
